# Face's Emotion Recognition

[![forthebadge made-with-python](http://ForTheBadge.com/images/badges/made-with-python.svg)](https://www.python.org/)                 
[![Python 3.10](https://img.shields.io/badge/python-3.10-blue.svg)](https://www.python.org/downloads/release/python-360/) 
![0](https://recfaces.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/03/rf-emotion-recognition-rf-830x495-1.jpeg)


## Overview
- This project aims to recognize emotions in facial images using the MobileNetV2 deep neural network architecture. MobileNetV2 is specifically chosen for its lightweight design, making it suitable for real-time emotion detection on mobile devices with limited computational resources.
 ## How it works
1. Data Collection: A labeled dataset of facial images with various emotions (e.g., happy, sad, angry, surprised) is collected to train and evaluate the MobileNetV2 model.
2. Preprocessing: The collected facial images undergo preprocessing to ensure consistency in format and size. Common preprocessing steps include resizing, normalization, and data augmentation to enhance the model's robustness.
3. MobileNetV2 Architecture: MobileNetV2 is a variant of the MobileNet architecture, which employs depth-wise separable convolutions to reduce computational complexity while maintaining good accuracy for the task of emotion recognition.
4. Training: The MobileNetV2 model is trained on the preprocessed dataset to learn to recognize emotions in facial images.
5. Inference: After training, the model is capable of making predictions on new facial images, accurately detecting emotions in real-time.



## FER-13 Dataset
![0](data:image/jpeg;base64,)

FER-13 dataset is a grayscale facial emotion recognition benchmark with 7 emotion categories.

## Requirements
- Python 3.5 +
- Tensorflow
- Keras
- Numpy 
- Matplotlib
- OpenCV

## Usage
```python
python code.py --input <path-to-image-or-video>
```
